availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Starke Rosecrans (Cincinnati, Ohio, merchant and soldier )

body.p: Cincinnati, Ohio, merchant and soldier. Kingston, Ohio native. Married to Anna E. Rosecrans. Father of Aaron Rosecrans, Mary Rosecrans, Elizabeth Rosecrans, and Anna Rosecrans. Graduated from the United States Military Academy in 1842. Served in the Army Engineer Corps as second lieutenant and first lieutenant from 1842 to 1854. Architect and civil engineer in Cincinnati from 1854. Coal oil merchant in Cincinnati in 1860. Served in the 23rd Ohio Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as colonel in May 1861. Served in U.S. Army as brigadier general and major general from May 1861 to March 28, 1867.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati, Ward 15, p. 61.
Joseph Taggart, Biographical sketches of the eminent American patriots, (Burton Company, 1907), 270-299.
